metadata.title: Execute GO/NO-GO Decision Framework for Production Refactoring

story.iWant: to evaluate Epic 1 Phase 0 results against comprehensive GO/NO-GO decision criteria
story.soThat: I can make an informed, evidence-based decision about proceeding to Epic 2+ production refactoring with high confidence in architectural patterns and migration approach
story.tasks: - Task 1: Load and Review Epic 1 Evidence (AC1 Preparation) - Task 2: Execute Decision Framework Evaluation (AC1) - Task 3: Conduct Exhaustive Blocker Assessment (AC2) - Task 4: Render GO/CONDITIONAL GO/NO-GO Decision (AC3) - Task 5: Document GO/CONDITIONAL GO Transition Plan (AC4, If Applicable) - Task 6: Document NO-GO Alternative Approaches (AC5, If Applicable) - Task 7: Define Next Steps Based on Decision Outcome (AC6) - Task 8: Finalize Decision Documentation and Update Sprint Status

story-context.acceptanceCriteria:
AC1: Decision Framework Evaluation Documented - Evaluate ALL 7 Epic 1 validation criteria (infrastructure deployment, dendritic pattern, nix-darwin integration, heterogeneous networking, transformation pattern, home-manager integration, pattern confidence) with explicit PASS/FAIL determinations and evidence citations from Stories 1.1-1.13
AC2: Blockers Identified (If Any) - Conduct exhaustive blocker assessment across CRITICAL/MAJOR/MINOR severity levels, reviewing all Epic 1 stories, Story 1.13 integration findings, Story 1.12 physical deployment, test suite results, and documentation completeness
AC3: Decision Rendered - Formalize GO/CONDITIONAL GO/NO-GO decision based on AC1 evaluation and AC2 blocker assessment with explicit rationale and evidence traceability
AC4: If GO/CONDITIONAL GO: Production Refactoring Plan Confirmed - Validate Epic 2-6 plan documented, migration pattern components ready for infra application, test-clan configs ready to migrate, blackphos management decision made
AC5: If NO-GO: Alternative Approaches Documented - Document alternative architectures (nixos-unified, hybrid, extended validation), issues requiring resolution, timeline for retry/pivot, specific validation gaps
AC6: Next Steps Clearly Defined Based on Decision Outcome - Define immediate actions conditional on GO (sprint planning, Epic 2 kickoff, success metrics), CONDITIONAL GO (conditions tracking, re-evaluation), or NO-GO (halt planning, resolution work, stakeholder communication)

constraints.constraint: Story 1.14 execution focuses on evidence review, assessment, and documentation - NOT code implementation, builds, or deployments
ALL decision criteria evaluations (AC1) must cite specific Story 1.x deliverable, file path, test result, or deployment log - NO speculative assessments

Blocker assessment (AC2) must document exhaustive search methodology to prove absence, not oversight - review ALL Epic 1 stories, Story 1.13 findings, Story 1.12 deployment, test suite, documentation completeness

GO/CONDITIONAL GO/NO-GO decision (AC3) must follow explicit criteria: GO requires ALL AC1 PASS + zero CRITICAL/MAJOR blockers, CONDITIONAL GO requires MOST AC1 PASS + documented workarounds for MAJOR blockers, NO-GO requires ANY AC1 FAIL OR 1+ CRITICAL blocker
Every PASS determination in AC1 must reference specific evidence location (e.g., "Story 1.7 completion notes lines 45-67, test suite passing, zero regression validation")

AC1.7 pattern confidence assessment must evaluate ALL 7 patterns (dendritic flake-parts, clan inventory, terraform/terranix, sops-nix secrets, zerotier networking, home-manager Pattern A, overlay architecture) with HIGH/MEDIUM/LOW based on Epic 1 validation evidence
AC4 transition plan must validate Epic 2-6 plan completeness (all 6 epics documented, stories enumerated, effort estimated, machine sequence validated, stability gates documented)

AC4.2 must confirm migration pattern components ready for infra application: Story 1.13 migration-patterns.md (transformation steps), architecture guides (dendritic, clan, Pattern A), deployment checklists (zero-regression workflows), operational guides (user onboarding, age keys)

AC4.4 must select blackphos management strategy: Option A (revert to infra Epic 3 migration, centralize production fleet) OR Option B (keep in test-clan, preserve validation environment) with explicit rationale
Decision document output location: docs/notes/development/go-no-go-decision.md (new standalone) OR integrate into Story 1.13 integration findings doc (if comprehensive epic-level doc exists)
Story 1.14 completion triggers: (1) Story 1.14 status backlog → done, (2) IF GO: Epic 1 status backlog → done, Epic 2 status backlog → contexted
AC1.2 dendritic pattern validation must confirm zero regressions via test suite passing (18 tests) after Story 1.7 refactoring - no functionality losses acceptable
AC1.3 darwin integration and AC1.6 home-manager integration must confirm cross-platform proven: same modules work on both nixos (cinnabar, electrum) AND darwin (blackphos) platforms
AC1.4 heterogeneous networking must confirm bidirectional connectivity: SSH access cinnabar ↔ electrum ↔ blackphos validated via zerotier network (network ID db4344343b14b903, <20ms latency)

AC1.5 transformation pattern must confirm infra → test-clan migration process documented with reusable checklists for Epic 2-6 (Story 1.8 blackphos transformation successful using documented approach)
AC1.6 home-manager integration must confirm multi-user proven: crs58 (122 derivations), raquel (105 derivations), cameron, testuser configs all functional on respective platforms
Story 1.14 is final Epic 1 story - completion = Epic 1 DONE milestone, triggers Epic 1 retrospective (optional), Epic 2 kickoff (if GO decision)

ideas.test: Validate decision framework evaluation completeness: - ALL 7 criteria assessed (AC1.1 infrastructure, AC1.2 dendritic, AC1.3 darwin, AC1.4 heterogeneous, AC1.5 transformation, AC1.6 home-manager, AC1.7 pattern confidence) - Each criterion has explicit PASS/FAIL determination - Each PASS cites specific Story 1.x evidence (deliverable, file path, test result, deployment log) - Each confidence level (HIGH/MEDIUM/LOW) has rationale tied to Epic 1 validation scope - Pattern confidence summary table includes all 7 patterns (dendritic, clan, terraform, sops-nix, zerotier, home-manager, overlays)

Validate blocker assessment exhaustiveness: - Methodology documented (how exhaustive search conducted across Epic 1 stories, Story 1.13 findings, Story 1.12 deployment, test suite, documentation) - Blockers classified by severity (CRITICAL/MAJOR/MINOR using AC2 definitions) - If zero blockers: exhaustive search process documented to prove absence, not oversight - Blocker summary table includes count, severity, production readiness assessment

Validate decision rendering logic: - Decision outcome (GO/CONDITIONAL GO/NO-GO) follows explicit criteria from AC3 - GO decision: Validates ALL AC1 PASS + zero CRITICAL/MAJOR blockers - CONDITIONAL GO decision: Validates MOST AC1 PASS + documented workarounds for MAJOR blockers - NO-GO decision: Validates ANY AC1 FAIL OR 1+ CRITICAL blocker identified - Decision rationale explicitly ties to AC1 evaluation results + AC2 blocker assessment - Evidence traceability complete (every decision point references specific Epic 1 validation)

Validate GO/CONDITIONAL GO transition plan completeness: - Epic 2-6 plan validated (all 6 epics documented, stories enumerated, effort estimated, machine sequence confirmed) - Migration pattern components identified (Story 1.13 migration-patterns.md, architecture guides, deployment checklists, operational guides) - test-clan configs readiness confirmed (cinnabar, electrum, portable home modules crs58/raquel/cameron, secrets structure) - Blackphos management decision made (Option A revert to infra OR Option B keep in test-clan with rationale) - Epic 2 immediate next steps defined (Story 2.1-2.6 sequence, timeline, success metrics)

Validate next steps actionability based on decision outcome: - IF GO: Immediate actions defined (sprint planning update, Epic 1 retrospective, Epic 2 Story 2.1 preparation), Epic 2 kickoff sequence (Story 2.1-2.6), success metrics (cinnabar deployed, dendritic+clan applied, zerotier operational, stability gate) - IF CONDITIONAL GO: Conditions tracking defined (conditions.md creation, mitigation strategies, re-evaluation checkpoints) - IF NO-GO: Resolution work defined (halt Epic 2-6 planning, resolution stories Epic 1.15-1.16, stakeholder communication, retry timeline) - Next steps executable without ambiguity

Validate sprint-status.yaml updates match decision outcome: - Story 1.14 status updated: backlog → done (always, regardless of decision) - IF GO: Epic 1 status updated: backlog → done (Epic 1 complete milestone) - IF GO: Epic 2 status updated: backlog → contexted (ready for story drafting) - ALL comments and STATUS DEFINITIONS structure preserved in sprint-status.yaml - Story key 1-14-execute-go-no-go-decision found and updated correctly

Audit evidence traceability across decision document: - Every AC1 PASS determination cites specific evidence location (Story 1.x, file path, line range when applicable) - Example citations validate: "Story 1.7 completion, test suite passing (18/18 tests), zero regression validation per test harness results" - Pattern confidence assessments tie to specific stories: "Dendritic flake-parts confidence HIGH - Stories 1.1, 1.6-1.7 validation, test harness continuous validation" - No speculative assessments (all claims backed by Epic 1 deliverable evidence)
